notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A daily prayer book, Ashkenazi rite.

supportDesc.foliation: Hebrew original enumeration has been preserved.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi cursive script, of the 17th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2r 1 illustrated title page with a coat of arms, in pen and ink.
8v 1 textual illustration of the Temple, Elijah and Messiah, in pen and ink.
21r A drawing of double-headed eagle, with fleur-de-lis and a crown, in pen and ink.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather, blind-tooled. Spine: 'Preces in Synagoga Normatiens Usitata. Hebr. Mus. Brit. Jure Empt. 18.832.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: M. A. Lowy: purchased from him by the British Museum on 10 Januar 1852: inscribed, folio 34v.
